paper_title.en: Enhancement of Pionic Modes in the Quasielastic Region

paper_title.ja: 原子核のスピン・アイソスピン応答研究の新たな展開(共著)
paper_title.en: New Facet of Spin-Isospin Nuclear Responses

description.ja: 原子核は陽子と中性子というアイソスピン1/2,スピン1/2の粒子のなす有限量子多体系である.この2種類の内部自由度が共に関わる現象は,古くから原子核の探求に重要な役割を担ってきた.その測定には,電荷を変えスピンの向きを変える偏極粒子の荷電交換反応が有効である.最近の実験技術の進歩はこの困難な実験を可能とし,この研究に新たな光を投じた.本稿では,偏極陽子荷電交換反応(p^^→,n^^→)によって新たに測定されたスピン・アイソスピン応答の中で,特に低運動量領域でのべ一タ崩壊で知られるガモフ・テラー遷移のクエンチング問題と,高運動量領域でのパイオン・モードのエンハンスメント問題に焦点を絞り,両者の統一的理解を目指した最近の実験と理論の発展を紹介する.

publisher.ja: 一般社団法人日本物理学会

paper_title.ja: Quasi-Elastic d(p^^→, n^^→)2p Reaction and Spin Response Functions of the Deuteron : Nuclear Physics
paper_title.en: Quasi-Elastic d(p┣D4→┫D4, n┣D4→┫D4)2p Reaction and Spin Response Functions of the Deuteron

ja.name: Institute of Physics University of Tokyo
Institute of Physics University of Tokyo

en.name: Institute of Physics University of Tokyo
Institute of Physics University of Tokyo

description.ja: We calculated response functions of the deuteron for charge exchange processes, including the final state interaction between two protons. Using them we evaluated the double differential cross section and polarization observables of d( p^^→, n^^→)2p by means of plane wave impulse approximation with an optimal factorization. Calculation well reproduced the shape of the energy spectra of the cross section, though the magnitude was somewhat overestimated. It also reproduced the spin observables well.

paper_title.en: Extraction of Nuclear Spin Response Functions from Spin Observables of Nucleon Quasifree Scatterings(共著)
From Magnetic Moment to General Spin-Isospin Modes
Non-Orthogonality Problem in Continuum RPA studied by Orthogonality Condition
Relation among Theories of Inclusive Breakup Reactions
Nonuniqueness of the current operators and gauge invariance

description.en: For a point-like Dirac particle we describe a class of time-dependent unitary transformations which bring about an explicitly gauge invariant one-body current operator. We do not resort to the 1/m expansion scheme but retain all orders in 1/m. We exploit the nonuniqueness (unitary equivalence) inherent to the time-dependent unitary transformation method, and investigate its consequences on the nuclear electromagnetic interactions. We show that the nonuniqueness of the one-body current should influence the exchange current up to the quantity which is expressed in terms of the commutator of the nuclear interaction hamiltonian with the generator of the unitary transformation. We apply the result to the electromagnetic interaction of a nucleon in a relativistic mean field. © 1989.
